thread.title: Jose Mourinho believes £89m Paul Pogba is already proving he’s a bargain at Manchester United
thread.title_full: Jose Mourinho believes £89m Paul Pogba is already proving he’s a bargain at Manchester United

author: jgordon
title: Jose Mourinho believes £89m Paul Pogba is already proving he’s a bargain at Manchester United
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments JOSE MOURINHO believes that Paul Pogba is already on the way to proving himself to be a bargain – even at a cost of £89.3M. 
And he insists that when that world record fee is broken – he believes it will be this summer and he might even do it himself – the French superstar will look even better value for money. EPA Jose Mourinho has hailed his record signing Paul Pogba who he signed in the summer from Juventus Getty Images 7 The duo could win their first piece of silverware with the Red Devils in next week’s EFL Cup final against Southampton 
The Manchester United boss knows the transfer market is producing higher and higher prices – even for young, untried unknowns. 
He also knows that if he is to land his next big target Antoine Griezmann he might have to go as far as £100M to get him out of Atletico Madrid and beat off the likes of Manchester City, Barcelona and Chelsea for him. 
What he knows most of all is that when it comes to Pogba United did exactly the right thing in buying him back from Juventus. 
Even if he did leave for nothing back in 2012. 
He declares: “In a couple of years you will realise that he was cheap.” 
The Special One has never been afraid to break the bank to get who he wants. Getty Images The French midfielder celebrates with Zlatan Ibrahimovic after the striker’s hat-trick against Saint-Etienne Related stories 'He needs to adapt' Luke Shaw has been promised by boss Jose Mourinho that he still has a future at the club CITY TUNE UP Thomas Lemar faces Man City for Monaco this week but is ready for an Etihad move this summer I'M RON MY WAY BACK Brazil legend Ronaldo is inspiring Everton's Yannick Bolasie to recover from knee injury BIG SPENDER Man U ace Marcus Rashford lands himself a Premier League pad - after splashing out £1.85 million on mansion MY LUK'S OUT ON FIFA 17 Romelu Lukaku trolls Fifa 17 after he's snubbed in latest ratings - and might go to Pro Evo FOOTBALL ON TV What football is on TV today? Our guide to this week's live matches Guer are you? Huddersfield 0 Manchester City 0: Sergio Aguero shut out as near full strength City are easily matched by weakened Terriers Fan fury 10,000 Chileans to take to the streets in protest to convince Alexis Sanchez to leave Arsenal OAVIPS Burnley reward their loyal OAP fans by letting them lead the team out onto Turf Moor pitch for FA Cup clash against Lincoln Flash Gordon Leicester hope they have found the next Jamie Vardy in Stafford Rangers striker Josh Gordon BEST OF ENEMIES Slavisa Jokanovic stunned by silky Spurs as Mauricio Pochettino was such a rough and ready rival Back to the Future Michael Keane can be like Paul Pogba at Manchester United, says Rio Ferdinand PA:Press Association 7 He scored a vital away goal against Hull City in the EFL Cup semi-final second leg 
But when he compares what was paid for a player of Pogba’s ability to what he foresees will happen in a few months he shakes his head in disbelief. 
He declares: “I have to admit that not many clubs have this vision of anticipation of what can happen in the near future. 
“A few years ago £25million was for a phenomenal player but now £25 million is not even a player, only a prospect of a player. 
“Now, if you want to buy a good prospect, a good 20-year-old player that can be fantastic – and I say ‘can’ – you are paying without the can. 
“You are paying without the can, as if the can doesn’t exist and you are paying as if the player is already a big player. 
“So I think next summer can bring a few surprises at this level. Getty Images The former Juventus star has flattered to deceive this season according to many pundits, but did score a screamer against Swansea City Manchester United star Paul Pogba scores a direct hit in foot darts 
“And probably Paul will lose this status as the world’s most expensive player which will be a good thing. 
“I think that he has phenomenal conditions but I think the scrutiny on him is hard, is difficult. 
“When he plays very, very well which he does many, many times, people think it is normal from him. 
“Yet when he has a game when he is not so happy and he doesn’t perform so well you guys, pundits and even supporters go strong on him. 
“But that’s the price of being who he is – it is the price of his price. 
“I am pretty sure that next summer some players with only half his quality probably will cost the same money or more. EPA Antoine Griezmann is expected to join Manchester United in the summer 
“So I am waiting for that moment to release him from the scrutiny. 
“But I am really happy with his football and his happiness to play football because the most important thing for him is not to lose that happiness.” 
As he prepares to face Blackburn Rovers today Pogba would be happier still had he not now hit the woodwork eight times. 
The 23 year old has eight goals for his club and one for France so far and Mourinho purrs : “We have a few records in the season and this is an amazing one. 
“Imagine the eight posts and it would be an amazing record too so, you know, step by step. Getty Images 7 Jose Mourinho's men sit sixth in the table, 12 points behind leaders Chelsea 
“He is still very, very young but I can see his influence on the team now – yes, I can. 
“I am really happy with what he did, for example, at Leicester and against Watford. 
“People didn’t see him so much in dangerous areas. 
“But he gave us an incredible balance, recovering the ball, starting the building up from the back and was really impressive. 
“And at the top of the pitch he is a guy that can score goals. 
“So still very, very young. But he can be fantastic.” Ajax youngster Daishawn Redan on verge of move to Man United
